titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, Joan Dunlop FA252
titlestmt.author: Laura Montgomery

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-01 00:37:33 -0500.

did.unittitle: John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers, Associates, Joan Dunlop

physdesc.extent: 35 letter document boxes, 2 legal document boxes.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center holds legal title, copyright and literary property rights in the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Joan Dunlop papers document her work as serving as an associate in the office of the Rockefeller Family and Associates from 1971-1979. This is not a collection of her personal papers.

These papers detail Dunlop's important work in expanding John D. Rockefeller 3rd's population interests to include sexuality, sex education, family planning, and reproductive health and abortion rights.

These records include grants, contributions and gifts to broadened population interests, John D. Rockefeller 3rd's statement made at the World Population Conference, 1974 in Bucharest, and testimony to the Select Committee on Population. Additionally the papers include the presidential search and selection of George Zeidenstein, and the reorganization of Population Council as well as the work of the Population Education, Inc. and its Project on Human Sexual Development.
The collection spans from 1954-1979 with the bulk of it representing John D. Rockefeller 3rd's population interests from 1973 to 1978.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Joan Dunlop, a staff associate of John D. Rockefeller 3rd (JDR 3rd) from 1971-1979 with responsibility for his population interests played a vital role in broadening the scope of his population interests to include sexuality, sex education and reproductive health rights.

Dunlop was born in London on May 20, 1934. She attended Queens Secretarial College in London. After her schooling, she went to America and was hired by the Ford Foundation. She worked on urban policy projects that became the foundation for the Johnson's administration's War on Poverty. After working at the Ford Foundation she was employed in the New York City budget office under Major John V. Lindsay.
In the 1970s she served as an associate in the office of the Rockefeller Family and Associates.

Later on she became the president of the International Women's Health Coalition and played a pivotal role in making women's sexual and reproductive health rights a central tenet of the 1994 UN Conference on Population and Development in Cairo and the Women's Conference in Beijing in 1995.
She died of breast cancer on June 29, 2012 in Lakeville, Connecticut.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The Joan Dunlop papers were donated to Rockefeller Archive Center as a work product of the John D. Rockefeller 3rd papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The John D. Rockefeller 3rd Associates, Joan Dunlop papers are intellectually arranged into five subject based series, one of which has been further divided into subseries. No discernible original order of the collection as a whole existed. However, original order of the documents has been retained within each folder.
Series 4: John D. Rockefeller 3rd grants, contributions and gifts (1966-1978)

Series 5: Population (1954-1979) Subseries 1: Abortion (1971-1978); Subseries 2: Select Committee on Population testimony (1977-1978); Subseries 3: Population Council (PC) (1954-1979); Subseries 3.1: Administrative files (1954-1977); Subseries 3.2: Funding (1963-1979); Subseries 3.3: Nobel Peace Prize (1970-1972); Subseries 3.4: Presidendential search and reorganization (1959-1978); Subseries 4: Population Education, Inc. (PEI) (1972-1979); Subseries 4.1 Administrative files (1971-1979); Subseries 4.2 Project on Human Sexual Development (PHSD) (1972-1979); Subseries 4.3: Sex education (1969-1978); Subseries 4.4: Women and development (1974-1979); Subseries 4.5 World Population Conference, 1974 (1973-1976)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series 1 Administrative files, consists of time sheets, expense reports and monthly planners. These materials span from 1971 to 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series 2, Agricultural Development Council (ADC), contains Joan Dunlop's work associated with the Agricultural Development Council in dealings with correspondence, program reviews, board meetings, and interests in Asia. These documents span from 1973 to 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series 3 Other Rockefeller philanthropies and interests, consists of materials with which John D. Rockefeller 3rd was associated with including corporate philanthropy, Asian philanthropy, and other Rockefeller philanthropies and interests. These materials span from 1963 to 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series 4 John D. Rockefeller 3rd grants, contributions, and gifts, consists of material regarding John D. Rockefeller 3rd's population interests in funding reproductive health rights defense funds, abortion rights and family planning. These documents span from 1966 to 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series 5 Population consists of five subseries, all of which are related to Joan Dunlop's work as an advisor to John D. Rockefeller 3rd with regards to his population interests. Documents span from 1954-1979.
Subseries 1: Abortion consist of funding plans, strategic policies, grants related to abortion and news clippings. Documents span from 1971 to 1978.
Subseries 2: Select Committee on Population testimony contains John D. Rockefeller 3rd's testimony to the Scheuer Committee. Documents range from 1977 to 1978.

Subseries 3: Population Council contains administrative files relating to Population Council; funding program efforts including program budgets, grants, and fundraising actions; Nobel Peace Prize consideration documentation; and presidential search and reorganization documentation including resumes and efforts to reorganize. Documents span from 1954 to 1979.

Subseries 4: Population Education, Inc., consists of administrative files including funding and board meeting documentation. Second, the Project on Human Sexual Development records including John Gagnon fellowship files, the Cleveland Survey which was an empirical study of parental attitudes to their children's sexuality in Cleveland, Ohio, and a television project. Third, sex education and women and development are represented in this subseries as well. Lastly, this subseries contains files on the World Population Conference of 1974. These include the Population Manifesto, news clippings and correspondence concerning John D. Rockefeller 3rd's statement at the World Population Conference in Bucharest. The documents range from 1954 to 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subseries 4 Population Education, Inc., consists of administrative files including funding and board meeting documentation. Secondly, the Project on Human Sexual Development records including John Gagnon fellowship files, the Cleveland Survey which was an empirical study of sexual learning in the home environment and the way community resources affect the process in Cleveland, Ohio, and a television project. Thirdly, sex education and women and development are represented in this subseries as well. Lastly, this subseries contains files on the World Population Conference of 1974. These include the Population Manifesto, news clippings and correspondence concerning John D. Rockefeller 3rd's statement at the World Population Conference in Bucharest. The documents range from 1954-1979.
